## Description {#details}

Transforms the control flow graph on one single entry/exit region at a time.

After the transform all &quot;If&quot;/&quot;Then&quot;/&quot;Else&quot; style control flow looks like this:

<CodeBlock>/// 1
/// ||
/// | |
/// 2 |
/// | /
/// |/
/// 3
/// ||   Where:
/// | |  1 = &quot;If&quot; block, calculates the condition
/// 4 |  2 = &quot;Then&quot; subregion, runs if the condition is true
/// | /  3 = &quot;Flow&quot; blocks, newly inserted flow blocks, rejoins the flow
/// |/   4 = &quot;Else&quot; optional subregion, runs if the condition is false
/// 5    5 = &quot;End&quot; block, also rejoins the control flow
/// </CodeBlock>

Control flow is expressed as a branch where the true exit goes into the &quot;Then&quot;/&quot;Else&quot; region, while the false exit skips the region The condition for the optional &quot;Else&quot; region is expressed as a PHI node. The incoming values of the PHI node are true for the &quot;If&quot; edge and false for the &quot;Then&quot; edge.

Additionally to that even complicated loops look like this:

<CodeBlock>/// 1
/// ||
/// | |
/// 2 ^  Where:
/// | /  1 = &quot;Entry&quot; block
/// |/   2 = &quot;Loop&quot; optional subregion, with all exits at &quot;Flow&quot; block
/// 3    3 = &quot;Flow&quot; block, with back edge to entry block
/// |
/// </CodeBlock>

The back edge of the &quot;Flow&quot; block is always on the false side of the branch while the true side continues the general flow. So the loop condition consist of a network of PHI nodes where the true incoming values expresses breaks and the false values expresses continue states.

Definition at line 279 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/structurizecfg-cpp">StructurizeCFG.cpp</a>.

### findUndefBlocks() {#ac25e4b6a874225141f3f5211c089d59e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void StructurizeCFG::findUndefBlocks (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; PHIBlock, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallset">SmallSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;, 8 &gt; &amp; Incomings, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; UndefBlks) const</>}>
When we are reconstructing a PHI inside <code>PHIBlock</code> with incoming values from predecessors <code>Incomings</code>, we have a chance to mark the available value from some blocks as undefined.

The function will find out all such blocks and return in <code>UndefBlks</code>.
